website_summaries.verdict: The Roku LT is the best budget streaming-media device, easily topping the $35 Chromecast.
pros: The Roku LT offers nearly the full Roku experience for $50
More than 1,000 channels are supported, including Netflix, Amazon Instant, HBO Go, Hulu Plus, Pandora, MLB.TV, Amazon Cloud Player, and Vudu
It also has cross-platform search that scours several major TV and movie services to find content
cons: There's still no official YouTube channel
Some services, including Netflix, have an outdated interface compared with what's on other streamers
The Apple TV still works better within Apple ecosystem

customer_reviews.title: 👍 GREAT UP TO A POINT
customer_reviews.text: For almost three years this device has been great. Then, about a week ago we had an operational problem with HULU through Roku. It was rhen that I found out two problems with this company (Roku):1- it is virtually impossible to have direct and personal contact, though I could with HULU and 2-, through HULU, I was informed the Roku model I own has been discontinued and that was at the root of my original HULU problem. Hence I Am stuck needing a new device and still being charged a monthly fee by Roku. HULU CREDITED ME A MONTH’s fee!
customer_reviews.author: Good Ole Gramps

customer_reviews.title: Can't Connect it to Wifi Network Anymore
customer_reviews.text: This used to work for me, but now it doesn't. For some reason, I can't connect to my Wifi network anymore. And I am unable to run the software update on the "secret screen." I would have recommended this device when I first got it--because it worked back then--but now I can't recommend it. I've invested many frustrating hours and days trying to get this Roku to work, including chatting with somebody at Roku. The chat lasted for 45 minutes, then I had to to do something else so I ended the chat without resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Cassiday

customer_reviews.title: Ugh refurbished.
customer_reviews.text: Fed Ex left this 50 ft away from our house, down our driveway & far enough that it was out of sight. Interesting since tracking indicated they delivered it to the front porch... In the dark my cousin ran over the box, what a surprise. Roku was on the opposite side that was crushed & we thought it was fine, but how could we tell? It was only a little damaged since it was a used item but failed to work & a piece of the plastic face eventually fell off. Not sure if I would order refurbished again, certainly not if Fed ex "attempts" to deliver it.
customer_reviews.author: Green Orchard Mom

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value
customer_reviews.text: The Pros 1. Quality is great using a HDMI cable. 2. Has a good selection of channels including Netflix, Hulu Plus, Redbox, Pandora, and many others. 3. You can download a free app from the Apple App Store to use as a remote and to stream your music, photos, and videos. 4. The remote control has a Netflix button which takes you directly to the Netflix channel. 5. It is extremely easy to set up. 6. It is small and portable. You can take it anywhere there is a Wifi connection and TV. 7. It is very reasonably priced. The Cons 1. It doesn't come with a HDMI cable. 2. YouTube is not available on the LT version of Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Zink

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase all year!
customer_reviews.text: I can barely put batteries in a flashlight, so if I can install the Roku, anyone can! Looking forward to saying goodbye to Comcast and the enormous bills for cable. Once we get an indoor antenna, we're definitely pulling the plug. The only downside is the remote. WHY DO ALL REMOTES COME IN BLACK? This thing is so little and lightweight--I dropped it between the couch and it took me a day to find it! I now keep it stored in a bright pink bag so I don't lose it again. That being said, I love the simplicity of this remote--very easy to use. I am enjoying it tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: J. McCort

customer_reviews.title: Connects without HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Just received yesterday and connected. Because I have an older TV without an HDMI input, I chose this model. Connection was simple. Only issue is that my TV/monitor has only one yellow input and it is taken by my cable box. This comes with a red, white, yellow cord. I plugged the yellow into a green socket because that is all I have. The screen is grainy and black and white; but I can view. If I remove my cable box cord and plug into the yellow input, then it is in color, but no volume. I'll have to figure this out.
customer_reviews.author: TravelGal

customer_reviews.title: Love Roku...too bad this unit died after a few months....
customer_reviews.text: I gave this Roku to a dear friend as a gift in early January 2015, she just informed me that it has completely stopped working....Unfortunately it is beyond the return date....She loved it so much (initially) that we purchased a second unit for her hubby....his works fine...on her tv as well as his....and her Roku doesn't work on either TV...so It must be a problem with the unit she received...it's too bad...that it died after only 3.5 months... I've had one for a couple of years...and I LOVE mine...but her experience is disappointing....
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Great invention!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy it's small it's sleek the remote is small and it allows me to cut cable without missing my favorite shows! It comes with its own apps and you can download apps. of course came with Netflix, Hulu plus, and Amazon instant video. What I really liked about it is that it had channels for kids that you have to order but offered free clips that my son really likes to watch. Only downside is that the Roku does not always pick up the signal from the remote. You have to really point the remote at the Roku in order for it to work, and even then it is a little slow.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Eckels

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This has been working great for years. The remote is very easy to understand but 2 buttons popped off within the first year. There is an optional app for your phone that has a easy to use remote control which I use often.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Grauer

customer_reviews.title: Fire Your Cable Company
customer_reviews.text: With cable fees climbing to a ridiculous rate, I chose to disconnect and order ROKU as a great resource to see what I choose to see. Combined with Netflix and HULU I am able to watch more TV than I knew was out there. Easy to install. Easy to use. Easy to get hooked and stay up too late. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Joie Lake

customer_reviews.title: Junk....
customer_reviews.text: I was initially pleased when I got this one and the older version before it. However, because I still had cable, I seldom used it. Well, I quickly found out that the product has a short shelf life when the yard man cut my cable cord...I missed tv but thought I can at least watch Amazon Prime with my Rokus. Not. I basically have two pieces of junk. I contacted customer service via chat and was told that because I would receive a new one. Again, NOT. I personally don't recommend the Roku because my two stopped working so quickly despite not being used.
customer_reviews.author: MediaChick

customer_reviews.title: Older model, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Not in their new line up of versions 1, 2, 3. But works just fine as long as the modem isn't always going down with the cable company. They are doing some sort of internet upgrade that will make it faster. The Roku depends on a reliable wireless signal. I also have the previously named HD model which allows for a high def 1080 display. The LT is being enjoyed greatly at 720 pixels on an HD large screen that the person I gifted it to really looked forward to having.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roku Lt
customer_reviews.text: I so totally the love the Roku. I wanted a streaming device in my bedroom where I didn't have my gaming platforms. The Roku fit the bill and is super simple to install...however once installed I realized not only could I stream all my favoriate prescriptions such as Amazon and Netflix...but there were a ton of free channels I was so excited about the other channels available on Roku I had to get one for the livingroom and trust me as soon as my guest room/office is finished a Roku will go in there too. OBTW I also gave two as Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Love the Roku
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roku player (bought for another TV, not because the first one died). Although one of the cheaper models, I can't tell the difference between this and my more expensive one. I am not super into technology or anything, but for me this thing is just fine. I love being able to access Amazon Instant video through the TV, and enjoy many of the other channels Roku has to offer. Parents, take note- streaming media players are great if you have kids! There's always something to watch and NO COMMERCIALS if you're using Netflix or Amazon Instant Video.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Love at first sight!
customer_reviews.text: How do I love thee? You are always there for me, ready with Netflix and a world of programming I wouldn't even know about without you. I treasure you, my little purple pet, when I don't get a bill for cable or satellite and have access to programming that I want. Yes, about $50 one time to have you forever, added a nice shelf antenna and now 24/7 programming is free forever. Monthly media expense? $9 for the Netflix account. Try that budget trick! Don't be jealous because I purchased another one to live upstairs. I will always love you best.
customer_reviews.author: Starwoman33

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: Though the content selection is huge, I also own an Apple TV and having used the latter for a couple yrs now, I can't help comparing. I found the Roku LT slower to respond and the interface not as user friendly. I admit this is less than half the cost of Apple TV so that makes up for it. I bought this for a smaller TV so I am not hugely disappointed. This is my first Roku so I am not sure if the other versions are equally slow. Anyway, it's OK. The streaming is fine and the cost is low, so go for it if you don't mind it being not very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: sokate_lvr

customer_reviews.title: Love The Roku!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Roku! Wish I had listen to my daughter months ago when she raved about it. After just a few days of using, we reduced our premium cable to just basic cable. This reduced the cable bill by over $80 bucks! Plus, I use Youtube a lot for tutorials. Roku allows me to stream from the laptop or tablet to my TV, making it easier to view while I work on projects. Right now, I have the radio channel going as I type this. I have the Roku audio cables plugged into my receiver, so I don't have to keep the TV on. Love the Roku :)
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Worked on my ancient TV. I actually hooked it up through my VCR because (lol YUP I still have a VCR) because my TV does not have that 3-plug thing that the Roku needs. Also- if I want to attach my Roku to my more modern HDTV- I just have to unplug and replug, with the HGMI cable, into that TV. I don't have to resign in or anything! My only complaint is it seems harder to navigate/browse with the remote control. So usually, for Netflix, I will add movies to my list on the computer, then just play it on the TV. It is super quick to update though!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Vigario

customer_reviews.title: Love my roku!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my roku! I don't have a dvr nor do I have time to plan my life around show times so roku is perfect for me. I love that I can watch a whole season of something in such little time..you will need to have wifi and for some channels you will need to subscribe but there are so many more channels on there for free. My daughters each have one and they use it so much that we ended up taking the cable out of their rooms.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca knaggs

customer_reviews.title: Fast interface is a winner
customer_reviews.text: When we dumped satellite tv we bought the Roku for our upstairs television. We currently use out Xbox for streaming tv on the downstairs tv. I actually prefer the speed and interface of the Roku. The Xbox tends to "time out" and/or kick us off line if we pause a show. Also, the brief commercials on services like Hulu Plus are briefer on the Roku (on the Xbox you might get three or four 10-15 second commercials in a block, where as on the Roku you get one or two). The interface itself is simpler and faster, as well. All in all, completely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny from the Block

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, works great on older systems
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of the Roku line, but I chose this model specifically because of its compatibility with my parent's older television set (RCA style inputs only). The Roku LT has most of the features found on the higher-end models, but offers streaming capabilities to television sets that haven't entered the fully digital realm. It sets up in minutes and streams flawlessly offering access to many favorite channels such as Hulu Plus and Netflix. My parents were skeptical of the concept at first, but they have really enjoyed the ability to have control over what they want to watch and when.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommed this. It's very easy to use and there's so many channels to pick from!!! Works great if you have your Amazon Prime, Hulu & NetFlix accounts!!! I don't have regular cable or satellite any more all I need is this and the three I mentioned and still save money for the whole year!!! Dump your cable & satellite people and go with these things and get a box that gives you local channels which you can buy cheap anywhere and boom there you go!!!! The cable and satellite companies are a total waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mrm68

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming
customer_reviews.text: This device doesn't do anything that can't be accomplished using other methods, but, it streamlines the process and makes changing between vendors and portals simple. The interface is simple and easy to use I am not going to say it's worth the money because it really depends on what you want. This device does not enable you to do anything that you can't do on your own. It just makes changing between services really easy. I will not post to the word that I am lazy but when if I find a way to uncomplicate my world, I'll use it,EC
customer_reviews.author: grouchin

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We love our new Roku. We currently have a don't blu-ray DVD player that is connected to our wireless network so we can stream Netflix and Amazon Prime. We never had any problems with that device but we hated the user interface. After going to our friend's house and seeing the UI on the Roku we decided to get one when the DVD player bit the dust. But we were able to pick our Roku around Christmas and got a such a good deal on it that we had to buy it. In addition to the UI the Roku also has more channels and content available to stream.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Little Roku
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say that hasnt been said. This is a 2nd Roku for the house. Didnt need all the features offered on the higher up the chain Roku models so I went with another LT. Plugged it in, hooked it up to my TV, applied my network settings, added the device to my existing Roku, Amazon and Netflix accounts and was up and going in less than 15 mins Would have been nice to have had a HDMI cable included but I already had one sitting around anyway. Great product, great price, great packaging and great shipping. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Junkie

customer_reviews.title: It's Forcing Me to Sit Down And Take It Easy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy we got this. Amazon Prime and Roku really is a plus to my day. Right now we are watching the "Justified" series. Prior to Roku, the only time I'd sit down and put my feet up in front of the boob tube was to watch a video from Redbox, and prior to that, I would only watch "24" and then "Touch." I just didn't feel compelled to watch the tube when there really wasn't anything worth watching. Now we can choose in our time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Babushka Babe

customer_reviews.title: A good product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I was not aware that there were different levels of the ROKU... I am still unclear as to what all the things on the control mean. So far I have watched NETFLIX and sort of checked out the others shown. Still unclear about the monthly cost of the various programs. I see lots of free trials but don't know what the prices would be if I decided to subscribe. Glad I bought the ROKU and would recommend it.....lots cheaper than an X-BOX to get the program I was wanting...NETFLIX. Now I have it and am enjoying it. Thanks ROKU.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Champ
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the Roku XD for 2 years,trouble free.I bought this model for my 20's something daughter at Amazon's amazing price as a stocking stuffer and she loves it.Combined with a Sony Plasma TV,it made for a terrific Christmas present for her.Between Amazon Prime and Netflix,she now enjoys TV without cable or satellite and the higher prices.It worked perfectly out of the box and Amazon packaging/shipping was excellent as always.
customer_reviews.author: Lonewolf57

customer_reviews.title: I love Roku
customer_reviews.text: I love Roku! I bought a Fire TV, but found out real quickly that it doesn't buffer! I live out in the country with very slow internet speeds, so I needed a device that could buffer the video before it plays. The Fire TV couldn't do that for me. I returned it and picked up this Roku. The Roku buffers the whole episode I am watching and allows me to play it back with very little buffering during the show. If it is an standard definition show it never buffers again. Highly recommended for slower internet connections.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cook

customer_reviews.title: Older Roku that is quite slow right now
customer_reviews.text: This Roku is very slow right now. Maybe it was fast when it came out but now I have to wait several seconds after choosing an option
customer_reviews.author: Beriah Sellers

customer_reviews.title: We love Roku
customer_reviews.text: We gave up cable, use antenna for local channels and choose our other programming from Netflix, Amazon Prime, and this magic thing called Roku. It has oodles of entertainment, news, sports for free, plus other things you can pay for if you want. But if you stick to the free stuff, it's a one time purchase. My husband even likes seeing the Saturday football games on Sunday, he picks the one or two that were the best. Now if you are a fan, that might not be acceptable, for him it is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely easy to connect and get working. It was up and running in 3 to 4 steps which are all easily described in the packaging. Recommend this to anyone who wants to stream media through their TV and start cutting the ties to cable and satellite providers. My only complaint is that I started using an iPad app after setting up all the accounts on screen using the Roku remote. I should have connected the Roku and then used the iPad app to connect and set-up the other accounts such as Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: Save your money buy the other roku devices.
customer_reviews.text: This item is difficult to set up . I attempted to set it up and it would not receive my signal from 30 feet away so I attempted to set it up in the room where my dsl was located. It did recognize the wireless connection but I was not able to connect. After 2 hours of trying I have given up stick to the roku box models they are easy to set up and work so much better. The item got really hot too.
customer_reviews.author: newbee

customer_reviews.title: This "LT" model has always been good to us
customer_reviews.text: We own six (6) Roku devices; one for each television and radio location throughout the house. We have always purchased the "LT" version of the Roku based on our budget. Apparently there are faster, more powerful, Roku devices on the market. This "LT" model has always been good to us. Built solid enough that there are little-to-no crashes. Fast enough to load channels to our satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barnes

customer_reviews.title: I love Roku
customer_reviews.text: I love this, glad I can watch BBC and PBS programming and also the older TV series such as NYPD Blue, St. Elsewhere, also a lot of the TV series I missed while watching another series years ago, I subscribe to Hulu and Acorn (BBC) its not that much $15.00 combined, in comparison to what DTV was costing me every month with nothing on worth while. Hulu is free also and you can try the Acorn (BBC) free for a month
customer_reviews.author: Small Potatoes

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Fast and smooth, great hd picture. Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow we love this thing, got it on a lightning buy. The netflix browsing loads about 100x faster than the blue ray player and the streaming is WAY smoother than our brand new laptop. I have a 46" 1080p and I can't even tell the difference with the 720. Looks fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: eric hight

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for our family
customer_reviews.text: I received my first Roku box as a gift and loved it. Then I purchased one for our bedroom television so my poor husband wouldn't have to suffer through more of my Netflix marathons. We've used it extensively and it's kept up great. I've recently purchased another for our daughter's room. She loves to watch Youtubes and Amazon Prime. They connect easily and are easy to set up for each different account. We all really enjoy our boxes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic; thousands of channels free, easy and free controller apps too.
customer_reviews.text: This is one the best investments I have ever made. I pay for Netflix, but since I don't pay for cable, the fact that I can still get History Channel, AMC, TLC and basically any other program I want for FREE with this, it is well worth it. It keeps my two young ones entertained when they watch it too, and the apps on my laptop and for every smartphone (including Windows Phone) I wish I could rate it higher than 5 stars. Best investment you can make.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Martiniano

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as apple TV
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the Roku LT for the bedroom TV. We already have the Apple TV hooked to the main living room TV. The Roku was easy set up, less than 15 minutes and I was watching Netlix. Just as good as the Apple TV. Both products have a couple of seconds to load (hooked up wirelessly) but nothing unreasonable. I guess it depends on your wireless router. If your looking for a reasonably priced item , with the same qualities as Apple TV, go fot the Roku.!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: First time Roku user
customer_reviews.text: The Roku LT is very easy to setup but does require a credit card to activate. Most of the channels available are pay channels, but there a some that are free. The Roku says to leave it plugged in 24/7 but it will stay pretty warm to the touch so I unplug mine when not in use. If you get a Roku you should subscribe to Amazon Prime or Netflix or some other pay channel to truly enjoy your Roku. Trying to access only free channels is not a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: dawgalum75

customer_reviews.title: Roku Rules!
customer_reviews.text: Roku has become invaluable to me, as I am planning to break it off with my cable provider and go it on my own. With Roku, I have so many choices and it makes a boring, snowy afternoon so much more enjoyable with television series or movies to stream. It was simple to hook up (if I can do it, trust me, anyone can do it) and it's great when company comes over and someone wants/needs something to watch. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: I got a Roku a few years back and got ...
customer_reviews.text: I got a Roku a few years back and got this one for my aunt. Roku could kill off half of the U.S.! My dad curses me for the one I gave them. Imagine a world with endless movies, documentaries, popular series. There is now NEVER nothing on TV. In fact, I cut off my TV service. I can even check the weather and news (though the news is a day old). Be warned! Roku leads to endless hours sitting and watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Newton

customer_reviews.title: Best Streaming Device
customer_reviews.text: I love my Roku! We decided that paying $80-$100 or more a month for cable was just not worth it to us, but we love watching old re-runs and a few netflix originals. If you are considering being a cord cutter, buy a roku! We watch netflix most of the time use a WatchESPN log in for some sports and we have an antenna to pick up local networks and we don't miss cable at all! This streaming device has as many features as any of the other including apple tv. Even has more features and apps than we use. We love our Roku and recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roku products!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Roku for an extra bedroom and had an older TV without an HDMI input. This little guy fit the bill. The wireless has worked flawlessly and the image displayed through the standard video outputs is phenomenal. Couldn't have asked for more.
customer_reviews.author: Joel W Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Choppy video
customer_reviews.text: The video playback is a bit choppy for me, even though my high speed network definitely has the bandwidth. I have a Roku 3 in the other room that never has a problem, but there are weird skipping artifacts every few seconds on this device from the same sources (local network & internet video). I'd definitely recommend the Roku 3 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rupert P.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We have been using our game console for our on demand TV and wanted more channel options. I had been looking and reading over Roku products, saw the deal and took it. It was a great decision. We have ESPN, tons of movie channels, and your typical Netflix, Hulu, and Prime for TV, which shout out to Prime for the family friendly/kid options. I am very happy with the decision, no loading time, TV, movies, all with the click of a button and ready to use out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine. Have it hooked up to a 32" 720p tv. The wireless is only about 6' away. The only complaints I have are 1) The slippery round bottom remote, who thought that would be a good idea? If you try to hit a button when it's on a table it shoots across the table and when you put it down it rocks back and forth for 20 seconds and 2) I wish the main unit had an off switch, I unplug the power cable when not in use, it gets hot.
customer_reviews.author: doghair

customer_reviews.title: impressed
customer_reviews.text: This device was so easy to set-up; my 11 yr old son did it. Then I helped with all the logins. We got it for our kids so they could watch their favorite kid shows over and over and over. It's mostly used for Netflix and my kids can easily navigate to get there. The parents love all of the extra apps and are pleasantly surprised at how much Roku has to offer for free. Only wish we could operate the volume on the TV from the Roku remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a basic player that would allow me to watch Amazon instant streaming video and other streaming channels without adding a Blu-ray or similar player to our television. This was easy to set up and is easy to use. Every once in a while, the screen freezes for a short time, but I'm not sure whether that is an Amazon issue or a Roku issue. I love that this unit was inexpensive and that I can watch several channels without paying a monthly fee.
customer_reviews.author: Ktjmac

customer_reviews.title: streaming so easy
customer_reviews.text: This was probably one of the easiest pieces of equipment I've ever set up in my life. It was incredibly simple but very powerful in what it does. Streaming is very fast and from so many different vendors. I can watch anything I want for free or for a small fee if it's a new release. I love, love, love this!!! Especially for the price! So much easier than having to hook up my computer and use it to go to different sites... much easier than using my x-box for netflix and amazon videos too.
customer_reviews.author: BK Remmert

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture. I can't believe it's not cable.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of paying for cable.and cancelled my account. I thought I would have to be an antenna to get reception, but streaming video through the box is beautiful, even on my old analog TV. You can get great movies (especially with Amazon Prime), TV shows and. I may eventually get an antenna to pick up the local news, but for now, I get everything I want online. The Roku is a very economical way to get TV entertainment, and it is very easy to hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Roku, Roku, Roku
customer_reviews.text: Having used the PS3/PS4 and Xbox 360/one versions of netflix, amazon, etc, the interface for the ROKU is far superior. Easy to add channels, easy to peruse multiple channels, and even easier to move from tv to tv. This is a MUST have device for anyone who streams tv. I cannot emphasize enough how much i regret NOT purchasing this EARLIER than i did. If you buy one, you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Keller

customer_reviews.title: I love my Roku boxes!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 Roku boxes at the moment, This LT, an older HD one, and a Roku 3. Now that I've own all 3 versions I have to say that all of them are great machines, but the Roku 3 with the 5 times faster processor makes a huge difference in video load times and menu response times. Don't take this the wrong way, the LT is great and it's in my daughter's room anyways so it doesn't bother me, but all of my future ones will be the high end versions.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Huge Roku Fan
customer_reviews.text: We're big time fans of Roku and have continued to spread the word since we got ours last year. I love this thing. We went with the Roku over AppleTV and didn't even consider a Chromecast. We have one in the living room, bedroom, and have purchased them for several friends and family members. We have an LT and the Roku HD (now Roku 1) and to be honest, there's really no difference besides the color and the jumpback button on the remote. product_meta.title: Roku LT Streaming Media Player (Old Version)
product_meta.description:
ROKU LT STREAMING PLAYER (NEW 2013 VERSION)





Streaming is more affordable than ever. The Roku LT has all the essentials you need to enjoy 1,800+ channels of movies, TV shows, music, sports, and more. With a free Roku app, one-stop search and channel shortcut buttons, the Roku LT delivers simply the best streaming value available anywhere.

 * 1,800+ entertainment channels. Choose from the best selection and widest variety of streaming entertainment, including movies, TV shows, music, sports, news, and more.
 * HD video quality. Streams up to 720p in high-definition.
 * No hidden fees. Enjoy all the free stuff, like Pandora and Crackle, and access your own subscriptions, like Netflix and Hulu Plus.
 * Quick and easy setup. Sets up wirelessly in minutes with just a few simple steps.
 * Channel shortcut buttons. Jump straight to favorite channels such as Netflix and M-GO with the push of a button.
 * One-stop search.* Find your favorite movies and shows in a flash from top channels like Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, VUDU, and M-GO. 
 * Movies and TV shows, front and center. Instantly access the hottest blockbusters and hit TV shows, powered by M-GO, right from the home screen -- no extra account setup required.
 * Free iOS and Android app. Transform your mobile device into a Roku remote. Browse and add new channels. Even use your phone or tablet to send your music, photos and personal videos** to your HDTV.
 * Works with virtually any TV. Connects easily to HDTVs and standard definition TVs.

* One-stop search is for movies and TV shows and does not work with all channels. Premium subscriptions are required but are not included with purchase.
** Capability to share video available on iOS and select Android phones. See Roku.com for a list of devices that support this feature.



GET TO THE ENTERTAINMENT YOU WANT INSTANTLY
The Roku Channel Store has the largest selection of streaming channels available anywhere – with over 1,800 channels and more coming at a furious pace. Our on-screen interface lets you fly through screens, seamlessly search top channels and launch movies faster than ever before. Simply stream all your favorites, including:

 * Over 200,000 movies and TV shows at your fingertips from Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, HBO GO, M-GO, VUDU, Redbox Instant by Verizon and more
 * Music from Spotify, Amazon Cloud Player, Pandora, MOG, Rdio, VEVO and TuneIn Radio
 * Live sports packages including NBA League Pass Broadband, NHL GameCenter LIVE, MLS LIVE, UFCTV, and MLB.TV Premium
 * Family entertainment from PBS and Disney
 * Photo and video sharing via Facebook, Flickr, and Picasa
 * Top news sources with MSNBC, Fox News, Huffington Post, CNBC and Wall Street Journal Live

Of course, there are also tons of channels featuring international and lifestyle programming, tech news, podcasts, cartoons, and… well, you get the idea. 

COMPARE ROKU MODELS
Best streaming value. Instant streaming made easy. Stunning video with private listening. Fully loaded and lightning fast. TV compatibility Virtually any TV Virtually any TV Virtually any TV HDTVs only* 1,800+ entertainment channels Built-in wireless One-stop search across multiple top channels Plays up to 720p HD video Plays up to 1080p HD video** Channel shortcut buttons Remote with headphone jack 

Dual-band wireless (Wi-Fi a/b/g/n compatible) Motion control for games (Angry Birds Space included free) 

5x faster processor Ethernet, USB & microSD slot 

* Roku 3 works with HDTVs with HDMI port. HDMI cable not included with Roku players.
**Availability of 1080p HD video limited by channel provider and speed of broadband connection. 

IT'S RIDICULOUSLY EASY
From the simple remote to the intuitive interface, Roku LT was designed to set up in a few quick-and-easy steps. All you need to get started is a high-speed Internet connection (and a TV, of course). The built-in wireless and guided setup mean you can be up and running in minutes. And we bet you don’t even have to call your nerdy nephew for help.

INCLUDED WITH THE ROKU LT
 * Standard remote with channel shortcut buttons 
 * Two AAA batteries
 * A/V cable (red/white/yellow)
 * Power adapter
 * Get Started guide
 * 90-day manufacturer warranty

WHAT YOU NEED
 * High-speed Internet (like DSL or cable)
 * Wireless router
 * HDMI cable (for high-definition video)
 * Internet browser (for initial setup)

In general, the faster your Internet connection, the better the video quality. For the best viewing results, we recommend a minimum of 1.5 Mbps for standard definition and 3.0 Mbps for HD content. To test your network speed, visit either one of the following (free) websites: speakeasy.net/speedtest/ or www.speedtest.net. Please note that your Internet speed may vary throughout the day.

High-five your wallet. The Roku LT makes entertainment more affordable than ever with all the steaming essentials you need. Enjoy 1,800+ channels of movies, TV shows, music, sports, and more—most of them absolutely free. Access your existing subscriptions like Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Amazon Prime directly on your TV. And with included features like one-stop search, channel shortcut buttons, and the free Roku app, rest assured that all the streaming fun has just begun. The all-new Roku LT—simply the best streaming value there is.

Roku LT supports closed captioning on channels that support this feature, including Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, VUDU and Hulu Plus. Video output: 720p and 480p over HDMI. Audio output: digital over HDMI (7.1/5.1 channel surround sound pass-through and stereo). 12V -- .5A power adapter.
